__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== 25 bugs without a package and that may be about Gutsy ===
These bugs were just reported against Ubuntu which means they are less likely to get attention.  There are about 1376 <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-datecreated&search=Search&field.status%3Alist=New&field.importance%3Alist=Undecided&field.assignee=&field.owner=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch=&field.has_no_package=on|bugs]]</nowiki> in this state.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Assign it to a package, improve the title and mark it "Confirmed" '''or'''
* Assign it to a package, ask a question, mark it "Incomplete" and assign it to yourself '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found) '''or'''
* Reject it for a good reason

=== 25 bugs that are "New" and about Gutsy's kernel ===
These bugs were filed against linux-source-2.6.22 so have to deal with the kernel in the development release of Ubuntu.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Gather information required by the kernel team, mark it "Incomplete" and assign it to yourself '''or'''
* "Confirm" the bug if it has the information the kernel team requires '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found) '''or'''
* Reject it for a good reason

=== 20 bugs tagged "needs-improvement" ===
These bugs need some easy things done to improve the quality of the bug report.  This could include asking which release of Ubuntu it affects, changing the bug's title, assigning the bug to a package.  This list was created by Brian Murray, bdmurray on #freenode, so feel free to ask him for guidance if you need any.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Assign it to a package, improve the bug title,  and mark it "Confirmed" '''or'''
* Assign it to a package, ask questions, mark it "Incomplete" and assign it to yourself '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found) '''or'''
* Reject it for a good reason
